Name:
Z33
Provornyy (Проворный)
Fate:
Transferred to the Soviet Union, 2 January 1946
Scrapped, 1962
Reclassified:
As a training ship, 30 November 1954
As an Accommodation ship, 22 April 1955
Displacement:
2,657 long tons (2,700 t) (standard)
3,691 long tons (3,750 t) (deep load)
Range: 2,950 nmi (5,460 km; 3,390 mi) at 19 knots (35 km/h; 22 mph)
Armament:
1 × twin, 3 × single 15 cm (5.9 in) guns
2 × twin 3.7 cm (1.5 in) AA guns
2 × quadruple and 2 × single 2 cm (0.8 in) AA guns
2 × quadruple 53.3 cm (21 in) torpedo tubes
60 mines 
4 × depth charge launchers
